intro: Conospermum capitatum subsp. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved conospermum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to southeastern Australia, particularly in New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically smooth and glossy, which distinguishes it from other subspecies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments.
